jx.jx_en_mean: To restrain or correct by means of a sharp blow or emphatic censure
jx.jx_cn_mean: 平息，压制：用有力的一击或断然的指责来限制或纠正

lj.lj_ly: “thought&I{[he]}  was getting a little uppity and needed to be slapped down” (&b{New York Times})
lj.lj_ls: “觉得&I{[他]} 正变得骄傲自大需要加以纠正” (&b{纽约时报})

jx.jx_en_mean: To put a sudden end to; suppress

jx.jx_cn_mean: 名义上或象征性的惩罚

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (as a verb): probably imitative. The noun dates from the mid 17th cent

entry.def: If you slap someone, you hit them with the palm of your hand.

example.ex: He would push or slap her once in a while...
example.tran: 他偶尔会推搡她或是打她的耳光。

example.ex: I slapped him hard across the face...
example.tran: 我重重地掴了他一记耳光。

entry.def: If you slap someone on the back, you hit them in a friendly manner on their back.

example.ex: A large middle-aged lady slapped me on the back and said 'Nice to see you again.'
example.tran: 一位身材高大的中年女士拍了拍我的后背说：“很高兴再次见到你。”

entry.def: If you slap something onto a surface, you put it there quickly, roughly, or carelessly.

example.ex: The barman slapped the cup on to the waiting saucer.
example.tran: 酒吧服务生麻利地把茶杯放在了茶碟上。

entry.tran: (不合理或草率地)施加(赋税、禁令等)
entry.def: If journalists say that the authorities slap something such as a tax or a ban on something, they think it is unreasonable or put on without careful thought.

example.ex: The government slapped a ban on the export of unprocessed logs...
example.tran: 政府贸然禁止出口未加工过的原木。

example.ex: Thankfully the Government still hasn't discovered a way of slapping a tax on love, sunshine or air.
example.tran: 谢天谢地，政府还没有找到对爱情、阳光和空气课税的方法。

entry.def: If you describe something that someone does as a slap in the face, you mean that it shocks or upsets you because it shows that they do not support you or respect you.

example.ex: 'The Sun' calls it a massive slap in the face for the United States government...
example.tran: 《太阳报》称之为打在美国政府脸上的一记重重的耳光。

example.ex: Britons persist in treating any pay rise of less than 5% as a slap in the face.
example.tran: 英国人坚持认为加薪不到 5%不啻于一种羞辱。

entry.tran: 轻微的警告;轻微的惩罚
entry.def: A slap on the wrist is a warning or a punishment that is not very severe.

example.ex: The fine they gave her is just more or less a slap on the wrist.
example.tran: 他们对她开出的罚金不过是一个轻微的警告而已。

means.word_mean: 1. a blow from a flat object (as an open hand)
2. the act of smacking something; a blow delivered with an open hand
1. hit with something flat, like a paddle or the open hand;

If you touch me again I'll slap your face!

sentences.cn: 他们对参加罢工的工人大加镇压。

sentences.en: I gave the scoundrel a slap in the face.
